p: House sparrows and HOFIs were collected in ground traps in vineyards near Bakersfield, Kern County, California in late summer of 2007 ( Table 1). Additional HOSPs were captured in Larimer County, Colorado using mist-nets and/or ground grain-baited traps in late summer of 2010 ( Table 2) and AMCRs were collected in Oklahoma in 2011 using cannon nets ( Table 1). Birds were banded, bled to determine previous infection status, and then housed in groups of 5â€“6 per cage within a containment laboratory for two weeks to ensure cage adaptation and general health. Wild birdseed mix and fresh water were provided ad libitum with sand being supplied as a digestive supplement for HOSP and HOFI. Crows were provided a mixture of cat and dog food ad libitum.
